title: How Many Calories Are in Ham?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in ham per 100 g serving, including protein, fat, carbs, sodium details, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
h1: How Many Calories Are in Ham?
assumptions: Sliced, cooked, cured ham (boneless, like deli-style); no added sauces or breading.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, curing method, cut, and preparation; check labels for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of cooked ham provides about 145 kcal and 17 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Glazed with honey (1 tsp per 100 g)

faqs.q: How many calories in 100 g of ham?
faqs.a: Approximately 145 kcal for standard cooked ham.
Yes, about 1203 mg per 100 g due to curing process.

faqs.q: How much protein in ham per serving?
Calories in ham vs. turkey ham?
faqs.a: Similar, but turkey ham is often lower in fat (~120 kcal per 100 g).

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect ham calories?
faqs.a: Baking or frying adds calories if oil is used; boiling keeps it closer to base values.
